text: {| |} HMS Odin (N84) was an O-class submarine of the Royal Navy. She was laid down by HM Dockyard at Chatham in Kent on 23 June 1927, launched on 5 May 1928Chatham submarines and commissioned on 21 December 1929. The name Odin refers to the 74-gun, Danish man-of-war surrendered to the British in 1807. She served with the 5th Flotilla at Portsmouth in 1929–1930, with the 4th Flotilla at Hong Kong from 1930–1939, with the 8th Flotilla at Colombo in Ceylon in 1939–1940, and with the 1st Flotilla at Alexandria in Egypt in 1940. Odin was depth charged and later rammed on surface by the and the Folgore- class destroyer and sank in the Gulf of Taranto on 13 June 1940. ==References== Category:Odin-class submarines of the Royal Navy Category:Ships built in Chatham Category:1928 ships Category:World War II submarines of the United Kingdom Category:Lost submarines of the United Kingdom Category:World War II shipwrecks in the Mediterranean Sea Category:Maritime incidents in June 1940 Category:Submarines sunk by Italian warships
title: HMS Odin (N84)
